title: A 16-year-old is still cleaning a Kansas slaughterhouse months after his employer was fined over migrant kids
description: A 16-year-old whom NBC News is calling Pedro said he cleans blood and animal parts off the floor of a Kansas slaughterhouse, a job illegal for workers under 18.

title: Manhattan DA Alvin Bragg is sent another threatening letter and white powder
description: The Manhattan district attorney whose office is prosecuting former President Donald Trump again received a letter containing white powder, two senior law enforcement officials said Wednesday.

title: Sen. Feinstein faces calls from Democrats in Congress to resign over health absence
description: Sen. Dianne Feinstein is facing calls to resign following a lengthy absence due to health issues, including from fellow California Democrat, Rep. Ro Khanna.

title: U.S. intel agencies may change how they monitor social media, chatrooms after missing leaked U.S. documents for weeks
description: The Biden administration is looking at expanding how it monitors social media and chatrooms after  intel agencies didn't see classified U.S. documents circulating online for weeks.

title: Fox News sanctioned for withholding evidence in Dominion defamation case
description: Delaware Superior Court Judge Eric Davis sanctioned Fox News and parent company Fox. Corp. for withholding evidence in the Dominion defamation suit on Wednesday.

title: Warner Bros. Discovery unveils new flagship streaming service, 'Max'
description: Warner Bros. Discovery on Wednesday unveiled its new blended streaming service of HBO Max and Discovery+, called “Max.”

title: Even as inflation cools, many Americans take financial hits to help their adult kids
description: Even as inflation cools, a Bankrate survey finds half of U.S. parents with children older than 18 are dipping into emergency savings to help them out.

title: Biden administration proposes toughest auto emissions standards yet
description: The Environmental Protection Agency unveiled a pair of proposals to dramatically cut auto emissions and spur the industry toward full electrification.

title: Ukraine vows to punish 'murderers' after video of an apparent POW beheading surfaces
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on condemned a video circulating online that the country’s security services said showed a Ukrainian being decapitated.

title: 80-year-old segregation wall finally comes down in Baltimore
description: For more than 80 years, Morgan State University students walking down Hillen Road near the school’s entrance saw a massive red brick wall.

title: Bodycam video shows rookie Louisville officer rush to bank shooting before being critically wounded
description: A rookie cop on just his fourth shift was one of the first two officers to descend upon the downtown Louisville bank where an employee opened fire Monday, and the rookie was hit in a barrage of bullets moments later that left him in critical condition, body-camera footage shows.

title: NPR quits Twitter, says the platform is 'undermining its credibility'
description: National Public Radio plans to shut down its Twitter accounts, saying the recent decision by the Elon Musk-owned platform to label it as "government-funded media" undermines its credibility.

title: Wendy’s takes aim at TODAY for National Roast Day
description: Fast food chain Wendy’s kicks off this year’s National Roast Day with a light-hearted jab at TODAY's Al Roker. If you want to get roasted by the Queen of Quips, just make a TikTok of yourself using the hashtag #National Roast Day.

title: Crime-fighting robot dog joins NYPD
description: New York City police unveiled three new high-tech pieces of crime-fighting technology, including "Spot," a robotic dog. WNBC's Gus Rosendale reports.

title: RoboCop? No, RoboDog: Robotic dog rejoins New York police
description: New York City officials unveiled three new high-tech policing devices Tuesday, including a robotic dog that critics called creepy when it first joined the police pack 2 1/2 years ago.

title: The worst of the economy's inflation surge is behind us, but higher prices are here to stay
description: The latest inflation report Wednesday from the Bureau of Labor Statistics is expected to show price increases for goods and services are slowing down.

title: Memphis council to vote on returning ousted Democrat Justin J. Pearson to the Tennessee Legislature
description: Memphis-area officials will meet Wednesday to decide whether to reinstate Justin J. Pearson to the Tennessee Legislature after Republicans expelled him.

title: Truck carrying 40,000 pounds of toxic soil from East Palestine train derailment overturns on highway
description: A truck carrying around 40,000 pounds of contaminated soil from the site of a train derailment in Ohio, which saw officials release toxic chemicals into the area to prevent an explosion, overturned on a highway this week, officials said.

title: Spiral of grief and death follows killing of Israeli sisters in the West Bank
description: The crowd spilled out of the funeral home, encircling the modest light caramel Jerusalem stone building nestled in the hills near Bethlehem.

title: Biden’s drug czar declares fentanyl laced with animal tranquilizer an ‘emerging threat’ facing U.S.
description: President Biden’s drug czar Wednesday declared that fentanyl mixed with xylazine, an animal tranquilizer known as “tranq,” is an “emerging threat” to the nation

title: Arnold Schwarzenegger posts video filling in 'giant pothole' in L.A. — but city says it was actually a service trench
description: Fed up by an enormous pothole in his Los Angeles neighborhood, Arnold Schwarzenegger picked up a shovel and filled it himself.

title: A missing woman was found alive inside a Jeep submerged in a Texas lake
description: A missing woman was discovered alive after a fisherman spotted her submerged Jeep in an East Texas lake, authorities said.

title: Rupert Murdoch and Fox Corp. board members sued by investor over ‘stolen election claims’
description: A Fox Corp. shareholder filed suit against Rupert Murdoch, Lachlan Murdoch and several members of the Fox Corp. board of directors in Delaware on Tuesday.

title: Tennessee GOP governor signs executive order strengthening background checks
description: Gov. Bill Lee signed an executive order designed to strengthen background checks, and called on the Legislature to pass the equivalent of a red flag law.

title: GOP Sen. Tim Scott of South Carolina to launch presidential exploratory committee
description: Sen. Tim Scott will announce the launch of an exploratory committee for a presidential bid Wednesday, a source familiar with the matter confirmed to NBC News.
